intro: Chomelia panamensis, commonly known as Panama chomelia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Chomelia panamensis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and habitat preferences.
